snippet: President Obama is said to be choosing between Larry Summers, his former economic adviser; Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve’s vice chairwoman; and Donald L. Kohn, a former Fed vice chairman.
abstract: Pres Obama is in process of interviewing three remaining candidates to replace Ben S Bernanke as chairman of the Federal Reserve--Larry Summers, vice chairwoman Janet L Yellen and former vice-chairman Donald L Kohn; supporters for Summers, widely considered Obama's personal favorite, are attempting to smooth over his brusque image in wake of vigorous opposition from Congressional Democrats.
lead_paragraph: President Obama is said to be choosing between Larry Summers, his former economic adviser; Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve’s vice chairwoman; and Donald L. Kohn, a former Fed vice chairman.

headline.main: Obama Narrows Field for Fed Chairman to 3
headline.print_headline: Obama Narrows Field for Fed Chairman to 3
